intro: Trigonostemon chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
